DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of the present study was to examine the native bacteria around the shoulder and determine the efficacy of three different surgical skin-preparation solutions on the eradication of bacteria from the shoulder.
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy of Surgical Preparation Solutions in Shoulder Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: A prospective study was undertaken to evaluate 150 consecutive patients undergoing shoulder surgery at one institution. Each shoulder was prepared with one of three randomly selected solutions: ChloraPrep (2% chlorhexidine gluconate and 70% isopropyl alcohol), DuraPrep (0.7% iodophor and 74% isopropyl alcohol), or povidone-iodine scrub and paint (0.75% iodine scrub, 1.0% iodine paint). Aerobic and anaerobic cultures were taken prior to skin preparation for the first twenty patients to determine the native bacteria around the shoulder and following skin preparation for all patients.
DOC.criteria: shoulder surgery or any type open wound, current infection, chronic immunosuppression
